wikipedia_page.main: Roy Gilbert Stevens (6 February 1933 – 6 October 1992) was an English cricketer and Royal Marines officer who became a prominent cricket administrator after leaving the forces. Stevens was born in Walmer, Kent and died at Ipswich, Suffolk.

response: Roy Stevens (1916–1988) was an American trumpet player, Stevens-Costello System brass embouchure teacher, and author of the Embouchure Self-Analysis: Stevens-Costello Triple C Embouchure Technique with Bill Moriarity.

Roy Stevens was born in 1916. His father was a tailor who died when Roy was very young. This was during the depression era so his family faced financial hardships that befell many families. Roy began playing trumpet professionally in his teens to support his family.
Don Ellis: jazz trumpet player, composer and band leader.On Don Ellis Tears of Joy album liner notes, song 5/4 Gateway, Ellis writes 'The high note at the end of my solo is dedicated to Roy Stevens.'

Dr. Elmer R. White:  trumpet player and educator - former Professor of Music at Appalachian State University Professor Elmer White studies with Roy Stevens led to his doctoral dissertation at Columbia University : Electromyographic Potentials of Selected Facial Muscles and Labial Mouthpiece Pressure Measurements in the Embouchure of Trumpet Players
By Roy Stevens, co-author and edited by Bill Moriarity, Embouchure Self-Analysis & The Stevens-Costello Embouchure Technique (Complete), 2nd edition.  Published by Create Space and sold by Amazon.com
